review: I already owned a Roku 3, but decided to give Amazon Fire TV a try for a TV in a different room. The menu navigation through the Fire TV is much slower than the Roku 3. With the Fire TV, there was a noticeable delay after pressing a direction button on the remote and seeing the cursor move to the next selection on the screen. It was not a huge problem, but noticeable enough to be annoying, especially considering that there is no noticeable delay on the Roku 3.The other problem I had with the Fire TV is that the video would randomly stop playing and display a "Network Connection Issue" message. When this happened, I was immediately able to restart the video and resume playback, so it didn't appear that the connection was actually lost at all. I know that there is no problem with my network or internet connection because I have no problems with streaming video on any other devices. Amazon technical support was not able to determine the problem, so they sent me a replacement device. However, the replacement (new) device had the exact same problem. I decided to return the Amazon Fire TV for a refund and purchase another Roku 3 instead. The Roku 3 has had no problems whatsoever and I'm very happy with it (and at the time of this review, the Roku 3 is $10 cheaper).
